격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 이 행위는 사기죄에 해당한다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: This act constitutes fraud.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to have the obligation to
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 고용주는 근로자의 안전을 보장할 의무가 있다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The employer has the obligation to guarantee workers' safety.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: regarding; concerning (used in legal/official titles and documents)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 개인정보 보호에 관한 법률이 개정되었다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The law regarding personal information protection has been amended.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to regard as; to deem
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 기한 내 회신이 없을 경우 동의한 것으로 간주합니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: If no reply is received within the deadline, it will be deemed as consent.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to comply with; to observe (rules, laws)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 모든 참가자는 대회 규정을 준수해야 한다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: All participants must comply with the competition regulations.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: commensurate with; corresponding to
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 위반의 정도에 상응하는 처벌이 내려질 것이다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Punishment commensurate with the degree of the violation will be imposed.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: in accordance with what was (decided/stated)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 이사회에서 결의한 바에 따라 인사 개편을 단행합니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: In accordance with the board's resolution, a personnel reorganization will be carried out.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to not permit; to prohibit
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 당국은 무허가 시위를 불허한다고 밝혔다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The authorities stated that unauthorized protests will not be permitted.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: I promise to (formal pledge to audience)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 국민의 기대에 부응할 것을 약속드립니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: I promise to live up to the expectations of the people.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: I will do my best to (formal commitment)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 국민의 안전을 지키는 데 최선을 다하겠습니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: I will do my best to protect the safety of the people.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: please (do something) (formal request/directive)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 질서를 유지해 주시기 바랍니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Please maintain order.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: I intend to; I would like to (formal speech opener)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 오늘은 우리 회사의 미래 전략에 대해 말씀드리고자 합니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Today, I would like to speak about our company's future strategy.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: I earnestly request/urge that
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 안전 수칙을 철저히 지켜 주실 것을 당부드립니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: I earnestly urge you to thoroughly observe the safety regulations.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: I humbly request that you (very polite request)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 관련 서류를 기한 내에 제출해 주시기를 부탁드립니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: I request that you submit the relevant documents within the deadline.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: inasmuch as; given that; to the extent that
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 모두가 노력한 만큼 좋은 결과가 있을 것입니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Given that everyone has worked hard, there will be good results.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to express one's deepest (gratitude, condolences, or apology)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 유족에게 심심한 위로의 말씀을 드립니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: I express my deepest condolences to the bereaved family.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: I wish to inform you that (formal notification)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 다음 달부터 운영 시간이 변경됨을 알려 드립니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: I wish to inform you that operating hours will change starting next month.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: please take note of; please be mindful of
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 출입 시 보안 절차에 유의하시기 바랍니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Please take note of the security procedures upon entry.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: shall; will (literary future expressing resolve or prophecy)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 이 땅에 평화가 찾아오리라 믿는다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: I believe peace shall come to this land.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: although it would be; even though (literary concessive)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 가고 싶으련마는 사정이 허락하지 않는다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Although I would like to go, circumstances do not permit it.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: I have been doing; I declare that I (archaic/literary declarative)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 평생을 이 연구에 바쳐 왔노라.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: I have devoted my entire life to this research.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: may it be so!; let there be (literary optative/wish)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 모든 이가 자유를 누릴지어다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: May all people enjoy freedom.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: for; since (literary causal reasoning)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 세월은 기다려 주지 않을지니 오늘을 최선을 다해 살아라.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: For time waits for no one, live today to the fullest.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to bring an item/agenda to the table; to submit an agenda item
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 이번 이사회에서 신규 사업 안건을 상정할 예정입니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: We plan to bring the new business agenda item to the table at this board meeting.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to prepare the meeting minutes
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 총무부에서 금일 회의록을 작성하여 배포해 주시기 바랍니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The general affairs department is requested to prepare and distribute today's meeting minutes.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to submit (a document) for approval
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 출장 경비에 대한 결재를 상신하였으나 아직 승인되지 않았습니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The approval request for travel expenses was submitted, but it has not yet been approved.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to hand over duties; to transfer responsibilities
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 퇴직 전에 후임자에게 업무를 인수인계해야 합니다.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: via; by way of; through (the channel of)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 모든 대외 문서는 법무팀을 경유하여 발송해야 합니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: All external documents must be sent via the legal team.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to conclude/enter into a contract
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 양사는 3년간의 공급 계약을 체결하였다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Both companies concluded a three-year supply contract.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to report on performance/results
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 분기별 실적을 보고하는 자리를 마련하겠습니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: We will arrange an occasion to report on quarterly performance.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to commence; to embark on; to undertake
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 내년 초 신규 프로젝트에 착수할 계획입니다.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to entrust entirely; to delegate fully
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 세부 일정은 실무진에 일임하기로 결정하였습니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: It has been decided to fully delegate the detailed schedule to the working-level staff.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to terminate/cancel a contract
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 상대 측의 계약 위반으로 인해 계약을 해지하기로 하였다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Due to the other party's breach of contract, it was decided to terminate the contract.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to request a review of
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 해당 조항에 대한 법률 검토를 요청드립니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: I request a legal review of the relevant clause.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to go through consultation/deliberation
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 관련 부서와 충분한 협의를 거친 후에 시행하겠습니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: We will implement it after going through sufficient consultation with the relevant departments.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: I ask for your understanding regarding
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 공사로 인한 소음에 대해 양해해 주시기 바랍니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: I ask for your understanding regarding the noise from the construction work.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: your esteemed company (honorific in business correspondence)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 귀사의 무궁한 발전을 기원합니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: We wish for the boundless growth of your esteemed company.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: our humble company (humble form in business correspondence)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 폐사에서는 귀사의 제안을 적극 검토하겠습니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Our company will actively review your esteemed company's proposal.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to fulfill; to carry out; to perform (obligations)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 계약상의 의무를 성실히 이행해야 합니다.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to not be cost-effective; to not be profitable
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 현재 시장 상황에서는 채산성이 맞지 않아 사업 철수를 검토 중이다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Given the current market conditions, it is not cost-effective, and we are reviewing withdrawal from the business.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: I kindly request a reply regarding
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 견적서에 관해 이번 주 내로 회신 부탁드립니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: I kindly request a reply regarding the quotation by the end of this week.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to win/receive an order (for a project or contract)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 당사는 해외 인프라 사업을 수주하는 데 성공하였다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Our company succeeded in winning the overseas infrastructure project order.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to reach the break-even point
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 사업 개시 2년 만에 손익분기점에 도달할 것으로 예상됩니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: It is expected to reach the break-even point two years after the business launch.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to publicly announce; to make an official notice
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 정부는 새로운 환경 규제를 관보에 공고하였다.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to issue an enforcement decree/executive order
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 개정법에 따른 시행령이 다음 달 발표될 예정이다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The enforcement decree under the amended law is scheduled to be issued next month.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to issue directives/instructions (from higher to lower government offices)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 중앙 부처에서 각 지방자치단체에 지침을 시달하였다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The central ministry issued directives to each local government.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to impose an administrative sanction/disposition
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 위반 업체에 대해 영업 정지 행정 처분을 내렸다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: An administrative sanction of business suspension was imposed on the violating company.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to have jurisdiction over; to oversee (official authority)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 해당 업무는 환경부가 관장하고 있습니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The Ministry of Environment has jurisdiction over this matter.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to issue an official announcement/notice regarding
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 보건복지부는 의약품 가격에 대한 고시를 발령하였다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The Ministry of Health and Welfare issued an official notice regarding pharmaceutical prices.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to have (something) fall under one's jurisdiction
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 국토교통부를 소관으로 하는 법안이 국회에 제출되었다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: A bill under the jurisdiction of the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure and Transport was submitted to the National Assembly.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to withdraw; to retract (a policy, statement, or proposal)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 정부는 국민의 반발에 직면하여 해당 정책을 철회하였다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The government withdrew the policy in the face of public backlash.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to send an emergency disaster alert
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 기상청에서 폭염 주의보와 함께 긴급 재난 문자를 발송하였다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The Korea Meteorological Administration sent an emergency disaster alert along with a heat wave advisory.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to pass a resolution; to vote to decide
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 국회에서 추경 예산안을 의결하였다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The National Assembly passed a resolution on the supplementary budget bill.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to officially announce; to publish (government data, results)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 선거관리위원회가 최종 투표 결과를 공표하였다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The National Election Commission officially announced the final vote results.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to issue a directive/order to subordinate offices
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 국방부는 전군에 비상 경계에 관한 훈령을 하달하였다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The Ministry of National Defense issued a directive on emergency alertness to the entire military.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to receive/accept a civil complaint or petition
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 주민센터에서 소음 관련 민원을 접수하였습니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The community center received a civil complaint regarding noise.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to enforce; to put into effect (a law, regulation, or policy)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 개정된 도로교통법이 7월 1일부터 시행됩니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The amended Road Traffic Act will go into effect starting July 1st.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to place the main focus on; to put emphasis on
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 본 정책은 취약 계층 지원에 주안점을 두고 있다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: This policy places its main focus on support for vulnerable groups.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to investigate and clarify; to determine the cause of
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 사고의 원인을 규명하기 위한 합동 조사가 진행 중이다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: A joint investigation is underway to determine the cause of the accident.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: empirical analysis of
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 본 논문은 소비 행태 변화에 대한 실증적 분석을 시도한다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: This paper attempts an empirical analysis of changes in consumer behavior.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to derive; to draw (a conclusion or result)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 수집된 데이터를 바탕으로 유의미한 결론을 도출하였다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: A meaningful conclusion was derived based on the collected data.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: it is judged/assessed that
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 현 단계에서는 추가 실험이 불가피한 것으로 판단된다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: At the current stage, it is judged that further experiments are unavoidable.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: according to prior/previous research
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 선행 연구에 의하면 수면 부족은 인지 기능 저하와 직결된다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: According to prior research, sleep deprivation is directly linked to cognitive decline.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to verify the validity/feasibility of
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 제안된 모델의 타당성을 검증하기 위해 시뮬레이션을 수행하였다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: A simulation was conducted to verify the validity of the proposed model.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to carry implications for; to have significance
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 이 연구 결과는 교육 정책에 중요한 함의를 지닌다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: These research findings carry important implications for education policy.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to control for variables
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 연령과 성별 변수를 통제한 후에도 동일한 결과가 관찰되었다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The same results were observed even after controlling for age and gender variables.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to exhibit/show a pattern of
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 두 집단은 뚜렷이 상반되는 양상을 보였다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The two groups exhibited clearly contrasting patterns.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: as for the limitations of this study
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 본 연구의 한계로는 표본 크기가 제한적이라는 점을 들 수 있다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: As for the limitations of this study, it can be noted that the sample size was limited.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to discuss from the perspective of
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 본 장에서는 사회학적 관점에서 이 현상을 논의한다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: This chapter discusses the phenomenon from a sociological perspective.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: considering the fact that; taking into account that
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 경기 둔화 추세를 감안하면 올해 성장 목표 달성은 어려울 것이다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Taking into account the trend of economic slowdown, achieving this year's growth target will be difficult.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to support; to corroborate; to back up (a claim or argument)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 이 실험 결과는 기존 가설을 뒷받침한다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: These experimental results corroborate the existing hypothesis.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to contribute to (achieving/accomplishing something)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 이 기술은 탄소 배출량을 줄이는 데에 크게 기여할 것이다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: This technology will greatly contribute to reducing carbon emissions.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to be in line with; to share the same vein as
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 이 주장은 최근 학계의 논의와 맥을 같이한다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: This argument is in line with recent discussions in the academic community.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: while; on the one hand (formal transitional connector)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 정부는 규제를 강화하는 한편 기업 지원책도 마련하였다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: While the government strengthened regulations, it also prepared support measures for businesses.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: accordingly; in accordance with this; as a result
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 수요가 급증하였다. 이에 따라 생산량도 대폭 늘렸다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Demand surged. Accordingly, production volume was also significantly increased.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: as (stated/shown/mentioned); in accordance with what
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 상기 보고서에서 분석한 바와 같이 시장은 회복 국면에 접어들었다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: As analyzed in the above report, the market has entered a recovery phase.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: not only... but also (sentence-level formal connector)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 비용이 절감되었을 뿐만 아니라 품질도 향상되었다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Not only were costs reduced, but quality was also improved.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: in addition to this; along with this
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 세금 인하가 시행되었다. 이와 더불어 복지 예산도 확대되었다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: A tax cut was implemented. In addition to this, the welfare budget was also expanded.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: on the basis of this; building upon this
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 1차 조사 결과를 확보하였다. 이를 토대로 심층 분석을 진행하겠다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: We have secured the results of the preliminary investigation. Building upon this, we will proceed with an in-depth analysis.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: in other words; that is to say (formal rephrasing connector)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 합격률이 10%에 불과하다. 다시 말해, 열 명 중 아홉 명은 탈락한다는 뜻이다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The pass rate is only 10%. In other words, nine out of ten people are eliminated.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: in contrast to this; on the contrary
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 국내 시장은 위축되고 있다. 이에 반해 해외 시장은 호조를 보이고 있다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The domestic market is shrinking. In contrast to this, the overseas market is showing a strong trend.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: as a result; consequently (formal conclusion marker)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 투자 확대가 지속되었고, 결과적으로 생산성이 크게 향상되었다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Investment expansion continued, and as a result, productivity improved significantly.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: in addition to; on top of (formal additive connector)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 원자재 가격이 상승한 데 더하여 물류비까지 인상되었다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: On top of raw material prices rising, logistics costs were also increased.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: in this context; against this backdrop
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 이러한 맥락에서 새로운 접근법이 요구된다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: In this context, a new approach is required.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: it is a well-known fact that
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 기후 변화가 전 세계적 문제인 것은 주지의 사실이다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: It is a well-known fact that climate change is a global problem.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: in short; to sum up; in a nutshell
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 요컨대, 이번 정책의 핵심은 규제 완화에 있다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: In short, the core of this policy lies in deregulation.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: there is a high probability/likelihood that
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 원가 상승에 따라 소비자 가격이 인상될 개연성이 높다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: There is a high likelihood that consumer prices will rise due to increasing costs.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: there is a strong chance that; it is highly likely that
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 합의 없이는 사업이 무산될 공산이 크다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Without an agreement, there is a strong chance the project will fall through.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to humbly say/tell (humble form of 말하다 in formal speech)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 한 가지 말씀드릴 것이 있습니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: There is one thing I would like to tell you.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to humbly ask (humble form of 묻다/물어보다)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 한 가지 여쭤 봐도 될까요?
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: May I humbly ask you one thing?

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to report/inform (to a superior; very formal/archaic humble speech)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 위원장님께 조사 결과를 아뢰겠습니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: I shall report the investigation results to the chairperson.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to announce one's future course of action (resignation, next steps)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 대표이사가 이번 주 내로 거취를 밝힐 것으로 보인다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: It appears the CEO will announce his future course of action within this week.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to provide an explanation/justification (in response to an accusation or inquiry)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 피의자 측은 혐의에 대해 소명할 기회를 요청하였다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The defendant's side requested an opportunity to provide an explanation regarding the charges.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to establish; to formulate (a plan, strategy, or policy)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 장기적인 국가 발전 전략을 수립해야 합니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: We must formulate a long-term national development strategy.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to devise; to work out (measures, solutions)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 교통 체증 완화를 위한 대책을 강구하고 있습니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: We are devising measures to alleviate traffic congestion.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to pursue; to seek to bring about
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 지역 경제 활성화를 도모하기 위한 정책을 추진 중이다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Policies are being promoted to pursue the revitalization of the regional economy.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to maintain; to uphold; to adhere to (a stance or principle)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 정부는 한반도 비핵화 원칙을 견지하고 있다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The government upholds the principle of denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to express; to declare (an opinion, position, or intent)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 여러 국가가 해당 결의안에 대한 지지를 표명하였다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Multiple countries expressed their support for the resolution.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to reserve; to withhold; to defer (judgment, a decision)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 위원회는 최종 결정을 다음 회의까지 유보하기로 했다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The committee decided to defer the final decision until the next meeting.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to refrain from; to avoid (a negative practice or tendency)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 형식적인 논의를 지양하고 실질적인 대안을 마련해야 한다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: We should refrain from superficial discussions and prepare substantive alternatives.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to aspire to; to aim toward; to pursue (a goal or ideal)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 우리 사회는 다양성과 포용을 지향해야 한다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Our society should aspire toward diversity and inclusion.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to precede; to come before
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 제도 개혁에 선행하여 충분한 사회적 합의가 이루어져야 한다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Sufficient social consensus must be reached prior to institutional reform.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to sound out; to probe; to explore the possibility of
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 양국은 비공식 채널을 통해 정상회담 가능성을 타진하고 있다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Both countries are exploring the possibility of a summit through unofficial channels.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to politely decline/refuse
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 감사한 제안이지만, 일정상의 사유로 정중히 사양하겠습니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: It is a kind offer, but I must politely decline due to scheduling reasons.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to decline unavoidably; to refuse due to circumstances beyond one's control
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 내부 규정에 따라 부득이하게 거절하게 된 점 양해 부탁드립니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: We ask for your understanding that we must unavoidably decline in accordance with internal regulations.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to be difficult to accept (diplomatic refusal)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 현 시점에서 해당 조건을 수용하기 어려운 상황입니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: At this point in time, we are in a situation where it is difficult to accept those terms.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: there is no room for reconsideration
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 이번 결정은 최종적인 것으로, 재고의 여지가 없음을 알려 드립니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: We inform you that this decision is final and there is no room for reconsideration.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: I am sorry to have caused you concern (formal apology/soft refusal)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 이번 건으로 심려를 끼쳐 드려 죄송합니다만, 저희 입장을 말씀드리겠습니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: We apologize for causing you concern over this matter, but allow us to explain our position.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to express reluctance; to show difficulty (in accepting)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 상대 측에서 추가 비용 부담에 대해 난색을 표하였습니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The other party expressed reluctance regarding the additional cost burden.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: unavoidably; inevitably (formal adverb)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 예산 삭감으로 인해 불가피하게 사업 규모를 축소하게 되었습니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Due to budget cuts, we have unavoidably had to reduce the scale of the project.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to be difficult to comply with (polite refusal)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 말씀하신 일정에는 응하기 곤란한 점 널리 이해해 주시기 바랍니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: We ask for your broad understanding that it is difficult for us to comply with the proposed schedule.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to express regret (diplomatic/formal)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 이번 사태에 대해 깊은 유감을 표명하는 바입니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: We hereby express deep regret regarding this incident.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to submit/bring up an agenda item (for deliberation)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 다음 이사회에서 해당 안건을 부의할 예정입니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: We plan to submit the agenda item for deliberation at the next board meeting.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to raise an objection
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 위원 두 명이 수정안에 대해 이의를 제기하였습니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Two committee members raised objections to the amendment.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to put to a vote
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 충분한 토론을 거친 후 해당 안건을 표결에 부치겠습니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: After sufficient deliberation, we will put the matter to a vote.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to seek consent/approval (in a meeting)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 위원장이 참석자들에게 회의 연장에 대한 동의를 구하였습니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The chairperson sought consent from the attendees regarding the extension of the meeting.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to pass unanimously
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 해당 결의안은 만장일치로 가결되었습니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The resolution was passed unanimously.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to meet the quorum
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 출석 위원이 과반수를 넘어 정족수를 충족하였습니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: A majority of committee members were present, thus meeting the quorum.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to keep a stenographic/verbatim record
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 공청회에서는 발언 내용을 속기록으로 남기도록 하겠습니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: At the public hearing, we will keep a verbatim record of all statements.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to declare the meeting adjourned/closed
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 모든 안건의 심의가 끝났으므로 폐회를 선언합니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: As deliberation on all agenda items has concluded, I hereby declare the meeting adjourned.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to state/present one's opinion (formal)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 각 부서 대표가 차례로 의견을 개진하였습니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Representatives from each department presented their opinions in turn.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: Dear Sir/Madam; esteemed recipient (formal letter salutation)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 귀하의 건승과 발전을 기원합니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: We wish you good health and continued prosperity.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: please refer to the above (formal letter/email closing)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 변경된 일정은 첨부 파일과 같으니, 상기 내용을 참고하시기 바랍니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The revised schedule is as per the attached file; please refer to the above.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: we hereby notify you regarding ~ (formal notice phrasing)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 계약 조건 변경에 관하여 통보 드립니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: We hereby notify you regarding the change in contract terms.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: we kindly request a prompt reply
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 상기 문의 사항에 대해 조속한 회신을 부탁드립니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: We kindly request a prompt reply regarding the above inquiry.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: To: / From: (formal letter/document header)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 공문 상단에는 수신과 발신을 명확히 기재해야 합니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The recipient and sender must be clearly indicated at the top of an official document.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: we send/forward (this) as per the attachment
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 요청하신 자료를 별첨과 같이 송부 드리오니 확인 바랍니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: We are forwarding the requested materials as per the attachment; please confirm receipt.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to formally notify/give notice of
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 임대차 계약 만료일 3개월 전에 갱신 여부를 통지해야 합니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: You must notify whether you intend to renew no later than three months before the lease expiration date.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: I humbly ask for your leniency/favorable consideration
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 사정을 감안하시어 선처를 부탁드립니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Taking the circumstances into account, I humbly ask for your favorable consideration.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: we ask for your broad understanding regarding ~ (formal apology/notice)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 시스템 점검으로 서비스가 일시 중단되는 점 널리 양해 바랍니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: We ask for your broad understanding that the service will be temporarily suspended due to system maintenance.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: we respectfully pray for the repose of the deceased
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 유가족 여러분께 위로의 말씀을 드리며, 삼가 고인의 명복을 빕니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: We offer our condolences to the bereaved family and respectfully pray for the repose of the deceased.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to wish (someone) good health and success (ceremonial)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 새해를 맞아 임직원 여러분의 건승을 기원합니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: On the occasion of the new year, we wish all executives and staff good health and success.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to deliver a congratulatory address
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 총장님께서 졸업식에서 축사를 올리셨습니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The university president delivered a congratulatory address at the graduation ceremony.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to dedicate (a work, award, etc.) to someone (ceremonial)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 이 상을 묵묵히 헌신해 오신 모든 분들께 헌정합니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: I dedicate this award to all those who have devoted themselves quietly.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to deliver an opening address
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 학회장이 간략한 개회사를 한 뒤 기조 강연이 시작되었습니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: After the society president delivered a brief opening address, the keynote lecture began.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to celebrate reverently; to offer ceremonial congratulations
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 부처님 오신 날을 맞아 전국 사찰에서 봉축 행사를 거행하였습니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Celebratory ceremonies were held at temples nationwide on the occasion of Buddha's Birthday.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to read a memorial eulogy
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 유족 대표가 영전에서 추도사를 낭독하였습니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: A representative of the bereaved family read the memorial eulogy before the portrait of the deceased.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to confer/present a letter of appointment
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 장관이 신임 대사에게 임명장을 수여하였습니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The minister conferred the letter of appointment upon the newly appointed ambassador.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to file a lawsuit
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 피해자 측이 손해배상 소송을 제기하였습니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The victim's side filed a lawsuit for damages.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to pronounce/hand down a verdict
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 재판부는 피고인에게 징역 3년을 선고하였습니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The court sentenced the defendant to three years in prison.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to dismiss/reject an appeal
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 대법원은 피고 측의 항소를 기각하였습니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The Supreme Court dismissed the defendant's appeal.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to issue an arrest warrant
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 법원이 해당 용의자에 대한 구속 영장을 발부하였습니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The court issued an arrest warrant for the suspect in question.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to make a diagnosis (medical, formal)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 담당 의사가 정밀 검사 결과를 바탕으로 최종 진단을 내렸습니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The attending physician made the final diagnosis based on the results of the thorough examination.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: the prognosis is good/poor (medical)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 조기에 발견한 덕분에 예후가 좋을 것으로 판단됩니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Thanks to early detection, the prognosis is judged to be favorable.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to conduct a clinical trial
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 신약에 대한 제3상 임상 시험을 실시할 예정입니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: A Phase 3 clinical trial for the new drug is scheduled to be conducted.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to publish an academic paper
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 연구진은 해당 결과를 국제 학술지에 논문으로 게재하였습니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The research team published the findings as a paper in an international academic journal.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to prove/verify a hypothesis
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 실험 결과가 기존 가설을 입증하는 데 결정적인 역할을 하였습니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: The experimental results played a decisive role in proving the existing hypothesis.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to undergo peer review
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 본 논문은 엄격한 동료 심사를 거쳐 게재가 승인되었습니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: This paper was approved for publication after undergoing rigorous peer review.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Like talking to a wall (lit. 'reading sutras to a cow's ear')
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 우(牛) cow + 이(耳) ear + 독(讀) read + 경(經) sutra/scripture
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: No matter what I say, it's like talking to a wall.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: You reap what you sow (lit. 'your own doing, your own reward')
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 자(自) self + 업(業) deed/karma + 자(自) self + 득(得) obtain
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: That's what you get (you brought it on yourself).

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: To give up on oneself; to abandon all hope
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 자(自) self + 포(暴) be violent/reckless + 자(自) self + 기(棄) abandon/discard
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Don't give up on yourself — let's try again.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Sharing joys and sorrows together
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 동(同) together + 고(苦) suffering + 동(同) together + 락(樂) joy/pleasure
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: They're colleagues who shared joys and sorrows for 10 years.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Killing two birds with one stone
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 일(一) one + 석(石) stone + 이(二) two + 조(鳥) bird
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Exercise and stress relief — two birds with one stone.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Preparedness prevents disaster
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 유(有) have + 비(備) preparation + 무(無) without + 환(患) worry/disaster
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 유비무환이라고, 미리 준비해 두는 게 낫다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: As they say, preparedness averts disaster — better to prepare in advance.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Turning misfortune into fortune; a blessing in disguise
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 전(轉) turn + 화(禍) misfortune + 위(爲) become + 복(福) fortune/blessing
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Losing my job actually turned into a blessing in disguise.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Same bed, different dreams (outwardly together but thinking differently)
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 동(同) same + 상(床) bed + 이(異) different + 몽(夢) dream
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: They sat at the negotiating table, but were actually dreaming different dreams.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Things will eventually right themselves; justice prevails in the end
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 사(事) matter/affair + 필(必) necessarily + 귀(歸) return + 정(正) righteous/correct
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: As they say, things right themselves — the truth will come out.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Heart-to-heart understanding; unspoken mutual understanding
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 이(以) by means of + 심(心) heart + 전(傳) transmit + 심(心) heart
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Even without words, we understand each other heart to heart.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: After hardship comes sweetness; no pain, no gain
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 고(苦) bitter + 진(盡) exhaust/end + 감(甘) sweet + 래(來) come
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: They say sweetness follows bitterness — good days have finally come.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Unforgettable gratitude; deeply engraved in one's bones
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 각(刻) carve + 골(骨) bone + 난(難) difficult + 망(忘) forget
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: My benefactor's help is something I can never forget.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: The more the better
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 다(多) many + 다(多) many + 익(益) benefit + 선(善) good
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: When it comes to experience, the more the better.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: A ragtag group; disorganized mob
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 오(烏) crow + 합(合) gather + 지(之) 's (possessive) + 졸(卒) soldiers
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: That team is a disorganized mob with no strategy.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Crows gathering chaotically — no formation, no leader

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Lost in fog; completely in the dark
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 오(五) five + 리(里) ri (distance unit) + 무(霧) fog + 중(中) middle
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: The truth of the case is still completely in the dark.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Can't sit still; on pins and needles
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 좌(坐) sit + 불(不) not + 안(安) comfortable + 석(席) seat
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Waiting for the results, I was on pins and needles.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Blindly following the crowd; joining without thinking
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 부(附) attach + 화(和) harmonize + 뇌(雷) thunder + 동(同) same
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Don't just blindly follow — have your own opinion.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Like echoing thunder mindlessly — agreeing without understanding

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: A lesson from others' mistakes; learning from someone else's example
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 타(他) other + 산(山) mountain + 지(之) 's + 석(石) stone
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 그 회사의 실패를 타산지석으로 삼아야 한다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: We should take that company's failure as a lesson.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: A stone from another mountain can polish your jade — others' failures teach you

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Seeing something awakens desire; tempted by what you see
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 견(見) see + 물(物) thing + 생(生) arise + 심(心) heart/desire
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Seeing delicious food awakens my appetite.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Achievement through extreme diligence (studying by firefly/snow light)
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 형(螢) firefly + 설(雪) snow + 지(之) 's + 공(功) merit/effort
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: His success is the result of tireless diligence.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: From stories of scholars too poor for candles — one read by firefly light, another by snow's reflection

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Fellow sufferers sympathize with each other; misery loves company
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 동(同) same + 병(病) illness + 상(相) mutually + 련(憐) pity/sympathize
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Since we were in the same situation, I helped out of fellow feeling.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Too much is as bad as too little; excess is just as wrong as deficiency
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 과(過) exceed + 유(猶) still/as if + 불(不) not + 급(及) reach
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Even exercise follows the rule of moderation. Overdoing it ruins your body.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Icing on the cake; adding flowers to brocade
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 금(錦) brocade/silk + 상(上) on top + 첨(添) add + 화(花) flower
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: A promotion plus a bonus — icing on the cake.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Surrounded on all sides by enemies; desperate situation with no allies
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 사(四) four + 면(面) sides + 초(楚) Chu (kingdom) + 가(歌) song
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 여론도 등을 돌리면서 대통령은 사면초가에 빠졌다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: With public opinion also turning against him, the president found himself besieged on all sides.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Adding frost on top of snow; to make matters worse
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 설(雪) snow + 상(上) on top + 가(加) add + 상(霜) frost
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: On top of losing my job, to make matters worse, my health deteriorated.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Standing by idly; watching with folded arms
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 수(袖) sleeve + 수(手) hand + 방(傍) beside + 관(觀) watch
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: If you stand by idly watching injustice, you're no different from an accomplice.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: State of ecstasy; being completely absorbed; selfless trance
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 무(無) without + 아(我) self + 지(之) 's + 경(境) state/realm
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: I was so absorbed in the music that I entered a state of ecstasy.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Clear autumn skies (lit. 'sky is high, horses are fat') — the beauty of autumn
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 천(天) sky/heaven + 고(高) high + 마(馬) horse + 비(肥) fat/plump
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: The season of high skies and plump horses — autumn has arrived.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Deceiving with surface changes while the substance stays the same; a swindle
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 조(朝) morning + 삼(三) three + 모(暮) evening + 사(四) four
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: A policy with only its name changed is nothing more than a shell game.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Visiting three times to recruit talent; persistent and sincere effort to win someone over
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 삼(三) three + 고(顧) look back/visit + 초(草) grass/thatched + 려(廬) hut
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 그 인재를 영입하기 위해 삼고초려의 노력을 기울였다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: They made every effort, like visiting the thatched hut three times, to recruit that talent.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Enduring hardships for the sake of future revenge/success; sleeping on firewood and tasting gall
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 와(臥) lie down + 신(薪) firewood + 상(嘗) taste + 담(膽) gallbladder
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: I'm preparing my comeback with the determination of enduring any hardship.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Speaking with one voice; unanimous agreement
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 이(異) different + 구(口) mouth + 동(同) same + 성(聲) voice
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 모든 전문가가 이구동성으로 개혁이 필요하다고 말했다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: All experts unanimously said that reform is needed.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Adapting to the situation; thinking on one's feet
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 임(臨) face/approach + 기(機) opportunity/moment + 응(應) respond + 변(變) change
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: I dealt with the unexpected situation by thinking on my feet.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Snatching life from the jaws of death; a miraculous recovery
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 기(起) rise + 사(死) death + 회(回) return + 생(生) life
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: They snatched victory from defeat with a dramatic goal in the second half.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Worrying oneself sick; burning with anxiety
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 노(勞) labor + 심(心) heart + 초(焦) scorch + 사(思) thought
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Parents worry themselves sick over their children.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Living at ease; leisurely and carefree
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 유(悠) leisurely + 유(悠) leisurely + 자(自) self + 적(適) comfortable/suitable
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 은퇴 후 시골에서 유유자적한 삶을 보내고 있다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: After retirement, I'm living a leisurely life in the countryside.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Rewarding good and punishing evil
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 권(勸) encourage + 선(善) good + 징(懲) punish + 악(惡) evil
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Traditional fairy tales contain the lesson of rewarding good and punishing evil.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Never forgetting, asleep or awake; constantly thinking of something/someone
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 오(寤) awake + 매(寐) asleep + 불(不) not + 망(忘) forget
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: I long for my hometown day and night, never forgetting.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Swallowing the bitter and giving away the sweet — self-sacrifice (esp. by parents)
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 감(甘) sweet + 탄(呑) swallow + 고(苦) bitter + 토(吐) spit out
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: The mother lived her life swallowing the sweet and spitting out the bitter for her children.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: The parent swallows the bitter (hardship) themselves and gives the sweet (good things) to their children.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Scared out of one's wits; soul scattered in terror
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 혼(魂) soul + 비(飛) fly + 백(魄) spirit + 산(散) scatter
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: I was scared out of my wits when a sudden explosion was heard.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: The student surpasses the master; blue comes from indigo but is bluer
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 청(靑) blue/green + 출(出) come out + 어(於) from + 람(藍) indigo
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: For the disciple to surpass the master — the student has outshone the teacher.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: A narrow escape from death; surviving against all odds (nine deaths, one life)
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 구(九) nine + 사(死) death + 일(一) one + 생(生) life
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: I barely survived the landslide by the narrowest of margins.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Caught between a rock and a hard place; can neither advance nor retreat
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 진(進) advance + 퇴(退) retreat + 양(兩) both + 난(難) difficult
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 사업을 계속하자니 적자고, 그만두자니 투자금이 아까워 진퇴양난이다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Continuing the business means losses, but quitting means wasting the investment — I'm caught between a rock and a hard place.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: To make a comeback; to rally after defeat
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 권(捲) roll up + 토(土) earth/dust + 중(重) again + 래(來) come
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: We failed, but we're looking for a chance to make a comeback.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Stubbornly clinging to outdated methods (lit. 'carving a mark on the boat to find a dropped sword')
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 각(刻) carve + 주(舟) boat + 구(求) seek + 검(劍) sword
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 시대가 변했는데 아직도 각주구검식으로 하면 안 된다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Times have changed — you can't keep doing it the old way.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: From a story about a man who dropped his sword from a boat, carved a mark on the hull, and tried to find it at that spot after the boat moved

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Every shot hits the mark; unerring accuracy
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 백(百) hundred + 발(發) shoot + 백(百) hundred + 중(中) hit
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: That player hits every free throw without fail.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Great talents mature late; a late bloomer
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 대(大) great + 기(器) vessel + 만(晩) late + 성(成) achieve
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: As they say, great talents mature late — he finally succeeded in his fifties.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: A bosom friend; an inseparable companion
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 막(莫) none + 역(逆) go against + 지(之) 's + 우(友) friend
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: We have been the closest of friends since childhood.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: A clear mirror and still water; a calm and unclouded mind
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 명(明) bright + 경(鏡) mirror + 지(止) still + 수(水) water
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: You must judge with a calm and unclouded mind.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Karmic retribution; every action has its consequence
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 인(因) cause + 과(果) result + 응(應) respond + 보(報) repay
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 나쁜 짓을 하면 인과응보를 받는 법이다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: If you do bad things, karmic retribution will catch up with you.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: A negative example; someone whose mistakes teach you what not to do
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 반(反) opposite + 면(面) face/side + 교(教) teach + 사(師) teacher
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: I took his failure as a lesson in what not to do.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Running around in confusion; not knowing which way to turn
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 우(右) right + 왕(往) go + 좌(左) left + 왕(往) go
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: People ran around in confusion during the emergency.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: The whole story from beginning to end
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 자(自) from + 초(初) beginning + 지(至) to + 종(終) end
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Please explain the whole story from beginning to end.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Careful and thorough deliberation; deep consideration
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 심(深) deep + 사(思) think + 숙(熟) mature/ripe + 고(考) consider
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: After careful deliberation, I decided to change jobs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Making rapid progress day by day and month by month
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 일(日) day + 취(就) accomplish + 월(月) month + 장(將) advance
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: His Korean skills are improving by leaps and bounds.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Running about busily in all directions
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 동(東) east + 분(奔) run + 서(西) west + 주(走) dash
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: I'm exhausted from running around in all directions preparing for the event.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Self-praise; blowing one's own trumpet
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 자(自) self + 화(畫) paint/draw + 자(自) self + 찬(讚) praise
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: There's a limit to how much you should praise yourself.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Matching words with actions; practicing what one preaches
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 언(言) words + 행(行) actions + 일(一) one + 치(致) reach/arrive
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: If you are a leader, it is important to practice what you preach.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Unprecedented and unrepeatable; one of a kind
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 전(前) before + 무(無) without + 후(後) after + 무(無) without
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: That is an unprecedented and unrepeatable record in history.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Fighting a lonely battle; struggling alone against the odds
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 고(孤) solitary + 군(軍) army + 분(奮) exert + 투(鬪) fight
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Don't struggle alone — ask for help.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Charging recklessly in all directions; dashing about without a plan
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 좌(左) left + 충(衝) charge + 우(右) right + 돌(突) rush
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: He grew his business by charging ahead recklessly in every direction.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Repaying kindness with ingratitude; biting the hand that feeds you
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 배(背) turn one's back + 은(恩) grace + 망(忘) forget + 덕(德) virtue
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: I helped them, but they turned out to be an ungrateful person.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: A life-or-death decision; risking everything
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 사(死) death + 생(生) life + 결(決) decide + 단(斷) sever/judge
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: I entered the match with a do-or-die determination.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Helpless; unable to do anything; with hands tied
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 속(束) bind + 수(手) hands + 무(無) without + 책(策) plan
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: We were helpless in the face of the sudden disaster.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Progressing at lightning speed; advancing a thousand miles at once
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 일(一) one + 사(瀉) pour + 천(千) thousand + 리(里) ri (distance)
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: The negotiations progressed at lightning speed.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: A candle flickering in the wind; a precarious situation
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 풍(風) wind + 전(前) before + 등(燈) lamp + 화(火) fire
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: The company's survival hangs in the balance like a candle in the wind.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: The fisherman's gain; profiting from others' conflict
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 어(漁) fish + 부(夫) man + 지(之) 's + 리(利) profit
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 두 회사가 싸우는 사이에 어부지리로 이익을 챙겼다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: While the two companies fought, a third party profited from the conflict.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: The guilty party acting indignant; the thief wielding the stick
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 적(賊) thief + 반(反) instead + 하(荷) carry + 장(杖) stick
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 잘못해 놓고 오히려 화를 내다니 적반하장이다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Making a mistake and then getting angry about it — that's the pot calling the kettle black.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Sweet talk; honeyed words used to deceive
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 감(甘) sweet + 언(言) words + 이(利) profitable + 설(說) speech
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Don't be fooled by honeyed words.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Wholehearted devotion; single-minded loyalty
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 일(一) one + 편(片) piece + 단(丹) red/sincere + 심(心) heart
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: I will live with wholehearted devotion to my country.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: A once-in-a-thousand-years opportunity; an extremely rare chance
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 천(千) thousand + 재(載) years + 일(一) one + 우(遇) encounter
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: This is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity, so don't let it slip away.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Catching everything in one net; a complete roundup
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 일(一) one + 망(網) net + 타(打) strike + 진(盡) exhaust/all
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: The police rounded up the entire criminal organization in one sweep.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: A lone wolf; someone who insists on doing everything alone
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 독(獨) alone + 불(不) not + 장(將) general + 군(軍) army
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: If you act like a lone wolf, teamwork falls apart.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Gaining two things with one action; double benefit from a single effort
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 일(一) one + 거(擧) raise/act + 양(兩) two + 득(得) gain
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 재활용하면 환경도 지키고 비용도 줄이고 일거양득이다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Recycling protects the environment and reduces costs — a double benefit.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Gratitude beyond death; a debt of kindness one can never forget
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 백(白) white + 골(骨) bone + 난(難) difficult + 망(忘) forget
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: The kindness of saving my life is a debt I can never repay, even in death.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Foresight; the wisdom to see things before they happen
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 선(先) ahead + 견(見) see + 지(之) of + 명(明) clarity
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 그 투자자는 선견지명이 있어서 시장이 폭락하기 전에 주식을 팔았다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: That investor had the foresight to sell stocks before the market crashed.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Know your enemy and know yourself; key to victory
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 지(知) know + 피(彼) the other + 지(知) know + 기(己) oneself
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 지피지기면 백전백승이라고, 협상 전에 상대방을 철저히 분석해야 한다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: As they say, know your enemy and yourself and you'll win every battle — you must thoroughly analyze the other side before negotiations.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Befriend the distant and attack the near; a divide-and-conquer strategy
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 원(遠) far + 교(交) befriend + 근(近) near + 공(攻) attack
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 그 기업은 원교근공 전략으로 해외 파트너와 손잡고 국내 경쟁사를 압박했다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: The company used a distant-ally strategy, partnering with overseas firms to pressure domestic competitors.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Watching and waiting like a tiger; eyeing an opportunity
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 호(虎) tiger + 시(視) gaze + 탐(眈) glare + 탐(眈) glare
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 경쟁 업체들이 호시탐탐 우리 시장 점유율을 노리고 있다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Competing companies are watching like tigers, eyeing our market share.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Making an empty show of force; bluffing
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 허(虛) empty + 장(張) spread + 성(聲) voice + 세(勢) power
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 그의 강경한 발언은 허장성세에 불과했고, 실제로는 양보할 준비가 되어 있었다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: His tough talk was nothing but bluffing — he was actually ready to make concessions.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Use one's adversary to control another; divide and rule
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 이(以) use + 이(夷) outsider + 제(制) control + 이(夷) outsider
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 그 정치인은 이이제이 전략으로 반대파 내부의 분열을 유도했다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: The politician used a divide-and-rule strategy to provoke infighting within the opposition.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Groping in the dark; searching blindly for a solution
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 암(暗) dark + 중(中) middle + 모(摸) feel + 색(索) search
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 증거가 부족해서 수사관들은 암중모색하며 단서를 찾고 있었다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: With insufficient evidence, the investigators were groping in the dark for clues.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: When the lips are gone, the teeth feel cold; mutual dependence
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 순(脣) lips + 망(亡) perish + 치(齒) teeth + 한(寒) cold
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 두 나라는 순망치한의 관계라 한쪽이 무너지면 다른 쪽도 위험하다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: The two countries are so interdependent that if one falls, the other is at risk.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: A friendship of deep trust and understanding, like Guan Zhong and Bao Shuya
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 관(管) Guan Zhong + 포(鮑) Bao Shuya + 지(之) of + 교(交) friendship
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 우리 둘은 관포지교라 서로 잘못을 해도 이해하고 감싸 준다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Our friendship is so deep that we forgive and embrace each other even when we make mistakes.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: An inseparable bond, like water and fish
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 수(水) water + 어(魚) fish + 지(之) of + 교(交) friendship
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 유비와 제갈량은 수어지교의 관계로 서로 없이는 큰일을 이룰 수 없었다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Liu Bei and Zhuge Liang had an inseparable bond — neither could accomplish great things without the other.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Partings and reunions; the cycle of coming together and breaking apart
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 이(離) separate + 합(合) unite + 집(集) gather + 산(散) scatter
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 정치판에서는 이합집산이 반복되어 어제의 적이 오늘의 동지가 된다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: In politics, alliances constantly form and dissolve, so yesterday's enemy becomes today's ally.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Repaying a debt of gratitude, even after death
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 결(結) tie + 초(草) grass + 보(報) repay + 은(恩) kindness
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 스승의 은혜에 결초보은하는 마음으로 장학금을 기부했다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: With a heart determined to repay my teacher's kindness, I donated a scholarship.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Growing old together for a hundred years; lifelong marital devotion
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 백(百) hundred + 년(年) years + 해(偕) together + 로(老) grow old
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 할아버지와 할머니는 백년해로하시며 서로를 한결같이 아껴 오셨다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: My grandparents have grown old together, cherishing each other faithfully throughout their lives.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Mutual help and support; assisting one another
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 상(相) mutually + 부(扶) support + 상(相) mutually + 조(助) help
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 이웃 간에 상부상조하는 문화가 점점 사라지고 있어 안타깝다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: It's regrettable that the culture of neighbors helping each other is gradually disappearing.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: A blessing in disguise; fortune and misfortune are unpredictable
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 새(塞) frontier + 옹(翁) old man + 지(之) of + 마(馬) horse
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 해고를 당했지만 새옹지마라고, 덕분에 더 좋은 직장을 찾게 되었다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: I was laid off, but as they say, misfortune can turn to fortune — I ended up finding a better job.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: All things are impermanent; nothing lasts forever
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 제(諸) all + 행(行) phenomena + 무(無) without + 상(常) permanence
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 제행무상이라는 말처럼, 아무리 강한 제국도 결국 멸망한다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: As the saying goes, all things are impermanent — even the mightiest empire eventually falls.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Form is emptiness; material things are inherently empty
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 색(色) form + 즉(即) is + 시(是) this + 공(空) emptiness
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 재산을 잃고 나서야 색즉시공이라는 말의 의미를 깨달았다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Only after losing my wealth did I grasp the meaning of 'form is emptiness.'

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Largely the same with minor differences
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 대(大) large + 동(同) same + 소(小) small + 이(異) different
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 두 후보의 공약은 대동소이해서 유권자들이 선택하기 어려웠다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: The two candidates' platforms were largely the same, making it difficult for voters to choose.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: A mix of truth and bluff; feinting and real moves intertwined
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 허(虛) empty + 허(虛) empty + 실(實) real + 실(實) real
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 협상 테이블에서 양측은 허허실실 전략을 구사하며 서로의 속내를 탐색했다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: At the negotiating table, both sides employed a mix of bluffs and real moves, probing each other's true intentions.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: I alone am supreme; extreme arrogance or self-importance
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 유(唯) only + 아(我) I + 독(獨) alone + 존(尊) revered
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 그는 유아독존 식으로 행동해서 팀원들의 반감을 샀다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: He acted as if he alone mattered, earning resentment from his teammates.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: All things flow and change; everything is in constant flux
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 만(萬) ten thousand + 물(物) things + 유(流) flow + 전(轉) turn
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 만물유전의 이치를 받아들이면 변화에 대한 두려움이 줄어든다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: If you accept that all things flow and change, your fear of change diminishes.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Hanging a sheep's head but selling dog meat; false advertising
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 양(羊) sheep + 두(頭) head + 구(狗) dog + 육(肉) meat
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 친환경이라고 광고하면서 유해 물질을 쓰다니, 양두구육도 이런 양두구육이 없다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Advertising as eco-friendly while using harmful substances — there's no better example of false advertising.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: A cunning rabbit has three burrows; always have backup plans
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 교(狡) cunning + 토(兔) rabbit + 삼(三) three + 굴(窟) burrow
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 그 사업가는 교토삼굴이라고 여러 나라에 자산을 분산해 두었다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: That businessman, like a cunning rabbit with three burrows, spread his assets across multiple countries.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Honey on the lips but a sword in the belly; outwardly sweet but inwardly treacherous
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 구(口) mouth + 밀(蜜) honey + 복(腹) belly + 검(劍) sword
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 그 사람은 구밀복검이라 겉으로는 친절하지만 뒤에서는 험담을 한다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: That person is honey-mouthed but dagger-hearted — kind on the surface but gossiping behind your back.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Good medicine tastes bitter; honest advice is hard to hear
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 양(良) good + 약(藥) medicine + 고(苦) bitter + 구(口) mouth
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 양약고구라고, 부모님의 잔소리가 결국 나를 바른길로 이끌었다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: As they say, good medicine tastes bitter — my parents' nagging ultimately led me down the right path.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Words that don't hold up; a nonsensical or absurd argument
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 어(語) words + 불(不) not + 성(成) become + 설(說) theory
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Cutting the budget while demanding better results — that's utterly absurd.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Binding oneself with one's own rope; getting trapped by one's own actions
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 자(自) self + 승(繩) rope + 자(自) self + 박(縛) bind
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 거짓말을 하다 보니 자승자박이 되어 스스로 모순에 빠졌다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: By piling up lies, he trapped himself in his own contradictions.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Drawing water to one's own rice paddy; a self-serving interpretation
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 아(我) my + 전(田) field + 인(引) draw + 수(水) water
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 같은 자료를 놓고 서로 아전인수 격으로 유리하게 해석하고 있다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Both sides are interpreting the same data in self-serving ways to suit their own arguments.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Overcome selfish desires and return to propriety; self-discipline
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 극(克) overcome + 기(己) self + 복(復) return + 례(禮) propriety
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Confucius taught that overcoming the self and returning to propriety is the essence of benevolence.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Firm patience that cannot be uprooted; steadfast perseverance
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 견(堅) firm + 인(忍) endure + 불(不) not + 발(拔) pull out
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 그녀는 견인불발의 자세로 10년간 연구에 매진한 끝에 성과를 냈다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: With steadfast perseverance, she devoted herself to research for ten years and finally achieved results.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Unity of knowledge and action; practicing what you know
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 지(知) know + 행(行) act + 합(合) unite + 일(一) one
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 환경 보호를 말하면서 일회용품을 쓴다면 지행합일이 아니다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: If you talk about protecting the environment while using disposable products, you're not practicing what you preach.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Cutting, filing, carving, and polishing; refining oneself through diligent effort
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 절(切) cut + 차(磋) file + 탁(琢) carve + 마(磨) polish
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: I honed my skills through mutual refinement with my colleagues.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Diligence and frugality; working hard and spending wisely
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 근(勤) diligent + 검(儉) frugal + 절(節) moderate + 약(約) economize
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 조부모님 세대는 근검절약을 미덕으로 여기며 살아오셨다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Our grandparents' generation lived by the virtue of diligence and frugality.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Clean and incorruptible; moral integrity and honesty
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 청(清) pure + 렴(廉) incorrupt + 결(潔) clean + 백(白) white
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 그 판사는 청렴결백하기로 유명해서 누구도 뇌물을 시도하지 못했다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: The judge was so well-known for integrity that no one even attempted a bribe.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: When you see profit, think of righteousness; putting ethics before gain
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 견(見) see + 리(利) profit + 사(思) think + 의(義) righteousness
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 기업인이라면 견리사의의 자세로 이익 앞에서도 도의를 먼저 생각해야 한다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: A businessperson should adopt the mindset of thinking of righteousness when faced with profit.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: Things keep getting harder (lit. 'the further you go, the bigger the mountain')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 해결하려고 했는데 갈수록 태산이다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: I tried to resolve it but things just keep getting harder.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: The tail wagging the dog (lit. 'the belly button is bigger than the belly')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 수리비가 배보다 배꼽이 더 크다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: The repair cost is more than the thing itself.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To be generous (lit. 'big hands') — esp. with food/hosting
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 우리 엄마는 손이 커서 항상 많이 해.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: My mom is generous so she always makes a lot.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: Well-connected; knows many people (lit. 'wide feet')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 그 사람은 발이 넓어서 어디든 아는 사람이 있다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: He's so well-connected that he knows someone everywhere.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: Not even enough to notice (of food — still hungry)
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 이거 먹어도 간에 기별도 안 간다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: Even after eating this, I don't feel a thing.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: Picky eater (lit. 'short mouth')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 아이가 입이 짧아서 먹이기 힘들다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: The kid is a picky eater so it's hard to feed them.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To bear a heavy burden/responsibility (lit. 'heavy shoulders')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 팀장이 되니까 어깨가 무겁다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: Now that I'm team lead, the weight on my shoulders is heavy.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To fall out of favor
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 상사 눈 밖에 나면 힘들어진다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: If you fall out of your boss's favor, things get tough.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To have high standards / be picky (lit. 'high eyes')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 눈이 높아서 아직 결혼을 못 했다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: Their standards are so high they haven't married yet.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: Easily swayed by others' opinions (lit. 'thin ears')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 귀가 얇아서 남 말에 잘 넘어간다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: He's easily influenced and falls for what others say.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To be arrogant/snobbish (lit. 'high nose')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 코가 높아서 남을 무시하는 경향이 있다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: They're arrogant and tend to look down on others.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: Words become reality; be careful what you say
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 말이 씨가 된다고, 부정적인 말은 하지 마.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: They say words become seeds — don't say negative things.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To be stabbed in the back; betrayed unexpectedly
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 믿었던 동료한테 뒤통수를 맞았다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: I got stabbed in the back by a colleague I trusted.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: A piece of cake; extremely easy (lit. 'eating cold porridge')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 이 정도는 식은 죽 먹기지.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: Something like this is a piece of cake.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: A matter of extreme urgency (lit. 'fire on the top of your foot')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 마감이 내일인데 발등에 불이 떨어졌다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: The deadline is tomorrow — it's a five-alarm fire.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: Nearly impossible (lit. 'picking stars from the sky')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 서울에서 집 사기는 하늘의 별 따기다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: Buying a house in Seoul is next to impossible.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To be heartbroken; to feel one's heart being torn apart
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 아이가 우는 모습을 보니 가슴이 찢어졌다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: Seeing the child cry tore my heart apart.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To be extremely busy; no time to even blink (lit. 'no time to open eyes and nose')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 연말이라 눈코 뜰 새 없이 바쁘다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: It's year-end so I'm incredibly busy with no time to breathe.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To rack one's brains; to scheme; to think hard (sometimes implies scheming)
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 어떻게 하면 좋을지 머리를 굴려 봤다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: I racked my brains trying to figure out what to do.
